title: What did Nikola Tesla eat? - Quora

response.answer_text: Tesla was OCD and a vegetarian, eventually he limited himself to a diet of only milk, honey, bread, water, some vegetables and whiskey - until prohibition which Tesla swore took decades off of his life, but he obeyed the prohibition 'law'. Tesla had a fear and aversion to germs (he had become very ill as a child and almost died) - and reportedly only ate boiled foods. Not a terrible idea in those years. However, Nikola Tesla died a virgin; significant only in that we have to wonder, "Does anyone really know?"   Tesla was never married or lived with anyone as an adult, so nobody can attest to first hand knowledge of his eating rituals.  Amusingly, one of his best buddies was Mark Twain. I can imagine them having fun creating 'Tesla tales' - pure speculation on my part, but entirely fathomable as well. I think it's a fact Tesla loved his whiskey - as he attested to loving it in his writings and in conversations - and others who knew him confirm it.

When he was elderly and much more eccentric, Tesla claimed that he was going to live to age 140, because he was eating “Factor Actus,” as well as warm milk and soda-crackers. Factor Actus was part of his longevity recipe: “Pure thoughts, abstinence, hard work, an occasional glass of wine, and a strict diet of a product I call factor actus. It's a simple health potion equivalent to the protein value of a dozen eggs, made from 12 vegetables including white leeks, cabbage hearts, flower of cauliflower, white turnips, and lettuce hearts.” - N. Tesla 7/1933, NYT interview
